snippet: A wet spring has swollen rivers across Hungary, Germany, Austria and the Czech Republic, forcing evacuations, disrupting traffic and causing major damage.
abstract: Danube spills over its banks in Budapest, claiming Hungarian capital as latest victim of record floods in Central and Eastern Europe; authorities ask more than 23,000 people to evacuate their homes in German city of Magdeburg as waters of Elbe river rise much faster than expected.

byline.original: By PALKO KARASZ and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: Palko Karasz reported from Budapest, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: A wet spring has swollen rivers across Hungary, Germany, Austria and the Czech Republic, forcing evacuations, disrupting traffic and causing major damage.

headline.seo: Hungary Braced as Danube Floods Parts of Budapest
headline.main: Floods Hit Part of Budapest, as a German City Is Threatened
headline.print_headline: Floods Hit Part of Budapest, as a German City Is Threatened
